organization-defined breadth and depth of modeling and analyses

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform threat modeling and vulnerability analyses during development and the subsequent testing and evaluation of the system, component, or service that:

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Uses the following contextual information: {{ sa-11.2_prm_1 }};

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Employs the following tools and methods: {{ sa-11.2_prm_2 }};

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Conducts the modeling and analyses at the following level of rigor: {{ sa-11.2_prm_3 }}; and

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Produces evidence that meets the following acceptance criteria: {{ sa-11.2_prm_4 }}.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Systems, system components, and system services may deviate significantly from the functional and design specifications created during the requirements and design stages of the system development life cycle. Therefore, updates to threat modeling and vulnerability analyses of those systems, system components, and system services during development and prior to delivery are critical to the effective operation of those systems, components, and services. Threat modeling and vulnerability analyses at this stage of the system development life cycle ensure that design and implementation changes have been accounted for and that vulnerabilities created because of those changes have been reviewed and mitigated.
